content.description: Smack the hollow flake at the start so you know its good, (bring drum sticks for extra ping). Using high feet and tension, pop to the slopes or knee bar into the closer crimps. Follow rail as it eases up, then slap the lip to topout. Morpho, temperature dependent whats not to love?
content.location: Just to the right of Truckload of Art."From the parking spots near the bathroom (ones with no campsite) go on the Cochise History Trail on the west side of the parking lot and take the light trail leading off and too the right near the first history maker plaque thingy on the paved trail. follow a left leanning weakness up a small boulder, then get ontop of a large flat boulder up and to the left. hopefully at this point the boulders are right infront of ya. Trail marked on map"

content.description: Have you paid your dues? Yes sir, the checks in the mail.Climb the scales to your hearts content. Bail to the right or yell send'er'die and commit to the direct. I downgraded the stars due to the horrendous fall.
content.location: From the parking spots near the bathroom (ones with no campsite) go on the Cochise History Trail just above the parking spot and take the light trail leading off and too the right. follow a left leanning weakness up a small boulder, then get ontop of a large flat boulder up and to the left. hopefully at this point the boulders are right infront of ya. Location marked on map

content.description: Start down in the hole, keeping on the look out for big'ol spiders, and other unholy desert fodder, on two chest high crimps. Move up and left to a dynamic mantle, using small crimps out left for support, or embrace the sweet kiss of death and trend right over the hole on slopers.
content.protection: 2-4 pads? fall is bad but the crux is protectable.
content.location: Just below TV-14."From the parking spots near the bathroom (ones with no campsite) go on the Cochise History Trail just above the parking spot and take the light trail leading off and too the right. follow a left leanning weakness up a small boulder, then get ontop of a large flat boulder up and to the left. hopefully at this point the boulders are right infront of ya. Trail marked on map"

content.description: On the back side of whammy bar, climb the short chicken head speckled face to a tricky topout.
content.location: On the back side of Whammy bar (north side) under a small tree.

pathTokens: Campground and Walk of Nature Loop Boulders

content.description: Small patch of boulders overlooking the campground to the west. Hoot at unsuspecting campers through the trees for full value.
